newsitem.title: GERMANY: Anzag posts stronger 95/96 results - paper.
newsitem.headline: Anzag posts stronger 95/96 results - paper.

text.p: German pharmaceutical wholesaler Andreae-Noris Zahn AG (Anzag) said it had posted higher turnover and profit in its 1995/1996 business year, which ended August 31, German newspaper Boersen Zeitung said.

Anzag's management board chairman Hermann Franke told the newspaper the wholesaler had "amply" reached its goal of posting earnings per share, as calculated according to the German DVFA method, of between 38 and 39 marks.
In its last business year, the group's earnings per share stood at 37 marks.

Franke said turnover climbed by 6.3 percent while cash flow grew at a double digit rate. The return on equity was over 13 percent and the group strives to post a 14 or 15 percent return in the future, Franke said.
Pharmaceutical wholesaler Sanacorp AG is Anzag's largest shareholder, holding a 24.9 percent stake and an option to buy another 14 percent. German DG Bank holds 13.9 percent, the newspaper reported.
